description: Let n encode the edges of a graph by taking edges (u,v), with u < v, in colexicographic order ((0,1), (0,2), (1,2), (0,3), ...) and adding each edge to the graph if the corresponding binary digit of n (starting with the least significant digit) is 1. a(n) is the smallest nonnegative integer that encodes the same unlabeled graph as n (disregarding any isolated vertices), i.e., the code of the graph as defined in A076184.
